summary: The Custom Health Option and Individual Care Expense Act (CHOICE Act) amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide tax treatment for health reimbursement arrangements (HRAs) integrated with individual market health coverage. It defines a "custom health option and individual care expense arrangement" and specifies requirements. The bill also specifies how these arrangements affects what’s included on W-2 forms for enrolled employees, permits participants in CHOICE arrangements to purchase Exchange insurance under a cafeteria plan, and establishes an employer credit for maintaining such arrangements. The Act aims to increase healthcare access and affordability.
